unnormalised: RBI clarifies the purpose of IFSC codes. Indian Financial System Code (IFSC) is an 11-character alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies a bank branch participating in the payment systems like RTGS, NEFT and IMPS. For example, SBIN0001234 represents a specific State Bank of India branch. Often confused with MICR (Magnetic Ink Character Recognition) code, which is primarily for cheque processing, IFSC is used for all online money transfers.
normalised: R-B-I clarifies the purpose of I-F-S-C codes. Indian Financial System Code (I-F-S-C) is an eleven character alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies a bank branch participating in the payment systems like R-T-G-S, N-E-F-T and I-M-P-S. For example, S-B-I-N zero zero zero one two three four represents a specific State Bank of India branch. Often confused with M-I-C-R (Magnetic Ink Character Recognition) code, which is primarily for cheque processing, I-F-S-C is used for all online money transfers.

unnormalised: This code is crucial for correctly routing funds during online transactions. Each bank branch has a unique IFSC code. You can find your bank’s IFSC code on your cheque book, bank statement, or the RBI website. Ensure you provide the correct IFSC when transferring funds to avoid transaction failures. Incorrect IFSC can lead to delays or funds being credited to the wrong account.
normalised: This code is crucial for correctly routing funds during online transactions. Each bank branch has a unique I-F-S-C code. You can find your bank’s I-F-S-C code on your cheque book, bank statement, or the R-B-I website. Ensure you provide the correct I-F-S-C when transferring funds to avoid transaction failures. Incorrect I-F-S-C can lead to delays or funds being credited to the wrong account.

unnormalised: It’s important to note that some banks, after mergers, have new IFSC codes. For instance, after the merger, old e-Syndicate Bank IFSC codes ceased to function and new Canara Bank IFSC codes like CNRB0004321 became valid. Always confirm the latest IFSC with your bank before initiating any online transaction to avoid inconveniences. Failure to update beneficiary details with the new IFSC can lead to transaction rejections.
normalised: It’s important to note that some banks, after mergers, have new I-F-S-C codes. For instance, after the merger, old e-Syndicate Bank I-F-S-C codes ceased to function and new Canara Bank I-F-S-C codes like C-N-R-B zero zero zero four three two one became valid. Always confirm the latest I-F-S-C with your bank before initiating any online transaction to avoid inconveniences. Failure to update beneficiary details with the new I-F-S-C can lead to transaction rejections.
